results.headline: Naked and the Dead, The
results.summary_short: Mailer's Pacific G.I.'s. Pious fadeout, but powerful battles and music.

results.headline: Law and Disorder
results.summary_short: Funny, diverting cops-and-robbers romp from England. Mite contrived but fun nevertheless, as served by fine cast.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Law and Disorder

results.headline: Tale of Two Cities, A
results.summary_short: Generally static and stagey, and Bogarde is terrible. Wait for the Hollywood-Ronald Colman beauty.

results.headline: Certain Smile, A

results.headline: Light in the Forest, The
results.summary_short: Indian-raised white boy returned to parents before Revolutionary War. Sturdy fare for younger viewers, via Richter novel. Nicely handled.

results.headline: Time to Love and a Time to Die, A
results.summary_short: Engrossing drama of young German soldier, World War II, via ``All Quiet'' author Remarque, in teacher role.

results.headline: Kings Go Forth
results.summary_short: War and love, Hollywood-style. But nice European locales, haunting Elmer Bernstein score.

results.summary_short: Aspiring young New Orleans singer vs. mobster. El bolstered by good supporting cast and local color.

results.headline: Key, The
results.summary_short: Wartime convenience, and a waiting woman. Pretentious drama with supposedly adult overtones. No dice.
